articles.author: John Hopewell
articles.title: Why Animation Is the Hottest Genre at Cannes’ Market
articles.description: Could the toon boom at the this year’s Cannes Market eventually lead to a toon bust? As the dust settles on the lineup of new movie projects unveiled in the French seaside resort, no trend is more apparent than the surge in ambitious independent animation fea…

articles.author: Terry Flores
articles.title: New Tech Helps Editors Work Creatively Far From Set
articles.description: As we move closer to a world of telecommuting and online collaboration, film editors are jumping on the bandwagon. As a group they’ve been traditionally somewhat removed from the day-to-day moviemaking process, working in dark suites far from the set. But it’…

articles.author: Hugo Martin
articles.title: As Napa and Sonoma counties recover from fires, Temecula vies to become tourist destination
articles.description: Even when the devastating October fires kept tourists away from Napa and Sonoma, wine lovers did not turn to the Temecula Valley. Instead, many vacationers who canceled trips to Napa and Sonoma counties during the fires booked trips to another wine-drinkers g…

articles.author: Tara Paniogue
articles.title: The Kooples brand decamps to Chateau Marmont to celebrate its latest Emily Ratajkowski collaboration
articles.description: French apparel and accessories brand the Kooples brought its Parisian-chic meets rock-‘n’-roll ethos to the Chateau Marmont this week to celebrate the launch of its most recent collaborative collection with model, actress and “Blurred Lines” star Emily Ratajk…

articles.author: Mary Forgione
articles.title: What travelers need to know about California's wine country fires: Napa winery and Santa Rosa's Round Barn destroyed
articles.description: The popular Signorello Estate winery in Napa and the historic Round Barn of Fountaingrove in Santa Rosa have been destroyed by wildfires sweeping across parts of Napa and Sonoma counties.

articles.author: John Verive
articles.title: Move over IPAs, light lagers are turning artisanal too
articles.description: Craft takes on the light lager, now gaining popularity, are great for beer-friendly events like the Super Bowl.

articles.author: Mikael Wood
articles.title: Bernie Grundman wants to change the way you hear music — for the better
articles.description: “A mechanical tool is following an intricate signal.” “These are coaxial speakers, and the tweeter’s in the throat of the woofer.” “Now you have 16 sets of stampers for a set of lacquers.” The language can get pretty heady when Bernie Grundman is talking shop…

articles.author: David Montero, Richard Winton, Ruben Vives
articles.title: In the solitary world of video poker, Stephen Paddock knew how to win. Until he didn't
articles.description: Stephen Paddock wanted to win and, like any savvy video poker player, knew which machine to lock down at Mandalay Bay. There was only one in the casino — a Jacks-or-better 9-6 machine, meaning it paid 9-to-1 credits on the full house and 6-1 on the flush and …

articles.author: Jem Aswad
articles.title: The 20 Best Albums of 2017
articles.description: Looking back through the dense media mist of the befuddling and seemingly endless 2017, our mid-year music special notes an unusual if obvious trend: The most popular genres of music — hip-hop/R&B and pop — are also the primary incubators of innovation. Still…
